./.title: Introduction
./.body: A Reference Grammar of Chinese A Reference Grammar of Chinese is a comprehensive and up-to-date guide to the linguistic structure of Chinese, covering all of the important linguistic features of the language and incorporating insights gained from research in Chinese linguistics over the past thirty years. With contributions from twenty-two leading Chinese linguists, this authoritative guide uses large-scale corpora to provide authentic examples based on actual language use. The accompanying online example databases ensure that a wide range of exemplars are readily available and also allows for new usages to be updated. This design offers a new paradigm for a reference grammar where generalizations can be cross-checked with additional examples, and also provides resources for both linguistic studies and language learning. Featuring bilingual term lists, this reference grammar helps readers to access relevant literature in both English and Chinese and is an invaluable reference for learners, teachers, and researchers in Chinese linguistics and language processing. CHU-REN HUANG 黄居仁 is Chair Professor of Applied Chinese Language Studies at the Hong Kong Polytechnic University and President and Fellow of the Hong Kong Academy of the Humanities. DINGXU SHI 石定栩 is Chair Professor of Chinese Linguistics at the Department of Chinese and Bilingual Studies of the Hong Kong Polytechnic University and Fellow of the Hong Kong Academy of the Humanities.

ta1ku1le0yan3lei4liu2ge4bu4ting2hecryLEtearsflowCLNEGstop ‘He cried and the tears came down continuously.’ 4.4.1-2 Unaccusative verb: one argument that can take either subject (definite) or object 4.27.b 旅客走了。 lü3ke4zou3le0passengerleaveLE ‘The passengers have left.’ 4.4.1-4 Unaccusative verb with or without subject, when the argument takes the object position 4.28.a 航运公司连续沉了三条船。 docs/chapter-14/14.1.html.title: 14.1. Sentences and Clauses
docs/chapter-14/14.1.html.body: 14.1 Sentences and Clauses 14.1-1 The verbs in Chinese don't agree with their subjects 14.1.a 那只鸟飞走了。 na4zhi1niao3fei1zou3le0thatCLbirdflygoLE ‘That bird has flown away.’ 14.1.b 那些鸟飞走了。 na4xie1niao3fei1zou3le0thosebirdflygoLE ‘Those birds have flown away.’ 14.1-2 The subject may be omitted 14.2 有一只乌鸦口渴了，[它]到处找水喝。 you3yi1zhi1wu1ya1kou3ke3le0ta1dao4chu4zhao3shui3he1YOUoneCLcrowthirstyLEiteverywhereseekwaterdrink ‘A crow was thirsty. It looked for water everywhere.’ 14.1-3 The clauses as subject or object don't go through any change 14.3 房价高涨说明经济很繁荣。 fang2jia4gao1zhang3shuo1ming2jing1ji4hen3fan2rong2house_priceriseshoweconomyverybooming ‘House prices are soaring, which suggests that the economy is prosperous.’

A: 复印讲义。 fu4yin4jiang3yi4copy_handout ‘Copying the handouts.’ 14.2.2-2 Complex sentence 14.6 他们因为路上出了车祸不去上海了。 14.2.2-3 Compound sentence: conditional 14.7.a 如果姐夫真的喜欢手套，那么我就会送给他一双。 ru2guo3jie3fu1zhen1de0xi3huan1shou3tao4na4me0wo3jiu4hui4song4gei3ta1yi1shuang1ifbrother-in-lawreallylikeglovesthenIthuswillgiven_toheoneCL ‘If my brother-in-law really likes gloves, I will give him a pair as a gift.’ 14.2.2-4 Compound sentence: 'incremental' conjuction 14.7.b 他不但输光了所有的钱，还输掉了所有的房子。 or you can come this afternoon.’ 14.2.3 Clauses with non-canonical constituent order 14.2.3-1 preposing of the predicate 14.8.a.1 i. 怪冷的，这儿。 guai4leng3de0zhe4er0prettycoldDEhere ‘Pretty cold here.’ 14.8.a.2 ii. 这儿怪冷的。 zhe4er0guai4leng3de0hereprettycoldDE ‘It’s pretty cold here.’ 14.8.b.1 i. 下班了，已经。 xia4ban1le0yi3jing1knock_off_workLEalready ‘Off work, already.’ 14.8.b.2 ii. 已经下班了。 docs/chapter-14/14.3.html.title: 14.3. Declarative and Exclamative Sentences
docs/chapter-14/14.3.html.body: 14.3 Declarative and Exclamative Sentences 14.3.1 Declarative sentences 14.3.1-1 Declarative sentences: adverbials can be placed either at sentence initial position or between the subject and predicate 14.11.a.1 i. 他当时戴着帽子。 ta1dang1shi2dai4zhe0mao4zi0heat_that_timewearZHEhat ‘He was wearing a hat at that time.’ 14.11.a.2 ii. 当时他带着帽子。 dang1shi2ta1dai4zhe0mao4zi0at_that_timehewearZHEhat ‘He was wearing a hat at that time.’ 14.11.b.1 i. 他也许是个聋子。 ta1ye3xu3shi4ge0long2zi0hemaybebeCLdeaf_person. ‘Perhaps he is deaf.’ 14.11.b.2 ii. 也许他是个聋子。 ye3xu3ta1shi4ge0long2zi0maybehebeCLdeaf_person ‘Perhaps he is deaf.’ 14.3.1-2 Declarative sentences with sentence final particles 14.12.a 我吃过晚饭了。 wo3chi1guo4wan3fan4le0IeatGUOdinnerLE ‘I have had my dinner.’ 14.12.b 他吃晚饭呢。 ta1chi1wan3fan4ne0heeatdinnerNE ‘He is having his dinner.’ 14.12.c 他正跟人下棋来着。 ta1zheng4gen1ren2xia4qi2lai2zhe0herightPREPpeopleplay_chessLAIZHE ‘He was playing chess with someone.’ 14.13.a 这个人有钱着呢。 zhe4ge4ren2you3qian2zhe0ne0thisCLpersonbe_richZHE_NE ‘This man is rich indeed.’ 14.13.b 你不要灰心，万事开头难嘛。 ni3bu4yao4hui1xin1wan4shi4kai1tou2nan2ma0youNEGwilllose_hearteverythingbeginhardMA ‘Don’t be disheartened. Everything is definitely hard at the very beginning.’ 14.13.c 你们肩上的担子很重啊。 ni3men0jian1shang4de0dan4zi0hen3zhong4a0youshoulderonDEcarrying_pole_plus_loadveryheavyA ‘The burden on your shoulders is heavy indeed.’ 14.13.d 我说的可是明天就兑现哟。 wo3shuo1de0ke3shi4ming2tian1jiu4dui4xian4yo0IsayDEactuallytomorrowthusfulfillYO ‘Tomorrow I will do what I said without delay.’ 14.3.2 Exclamative sentences 14.3.2-1 Exclamative sentences: (falling intonation) with Exclamative Punctuation 14.14 你这没有骨气的文人！ ni3zhe4mei2you3gu3qi4de0wen2ren2youthisNEGbackboneDEscholar ‘You spineless scholar!’ 14.15.a 真了不起！ zhen1liao3bu4qi3reallyamazing ‘Truly amazing!’ 14.3.2-2 Exclamative sentences: with exclamative adverbs 14.15.b 好一个“世外桃源”！ hao3yi1ge4shi4wai4tao2yuan2suchoneCLShangri-la ‘This is a true Shangri-la!’ 14.15.c 多少个日日夜夜啊！ duo1shao3ge4ri4ri4ye4ye4a1manyCLnight_and_dayA ‘So many days and nights!’ 14.15.d 多好的人哪！ duo1hao3de0ren2na0sogoodDEpersonNA ‘What a good man!’ 14.15.e 这是何等的英雄气概啊！ zhe4shi4he2deng3de0ying1xiong2qi4gai4a1thisbehowDEheroismA ‘What heroism!’ 14.15.f 怎一个“愁”字了得！ zen3yi1ge4chou2zi4liao3de2whyoneCLworrywordterrible ‘How a single word of “sorrow”could convey all (my) suffering!’ 14.3.2-3 Exclamative sentences: with sentence final exclamative particles 14.16.a 原来是我喜欢的鱼呀！ yuan2lai2shi4wo3xi3huan1de0yu2ya0turn_outbeIlikeDEfishYA ‘It’s the kind of fish that I like!’ 14.16.b 好哇！ hao3wa0greatWA ‘Great!’ 14.16.c 难哪！ nan2na0hardNA ‘Too hard!’ 14.3.2-4 Exclamative sentences: with exclamative particles at the sentence initial position 14.17.a 唉！你太不幸了！ ai1ni3tai4bu4xing4le0AIyoutoounfortunateLE ‘Ouch! docs/chapter-15/15.2.html.body: 15.2 PASSIVE CONSTRUCTIONS 15.2.1 The passive 15.2.2 Arguments of the passive 15.2.2-1 passives with two arguments have the patient in the clause-initial position as the subject, while the agent is introduced by one of the passive markers 15.56 那群老鼠仍然被那只猫追得死去活来呢。 na4qun2lao3shu3reng2ran2bei4na4zhi1mao1zhui1de0si3qu4huo2lai2ne0thatCLratstillBEIthatCLcatchaseDEhalf_dead_half_aliveNE ‘The mice were nonetheless chased to the point of exhaustion by that cat.’ 15.57 你别急，大姐已经被我妈劝回去了 。 ni3bie2ji2da4jie3yi3jing1bei4wo3ma1quan4hui2qu4le0youdo_notworryelder_sisteralreadyBEIImotherpersuadereturnLE ‘Don’t get upset. Eldest sister has already been persuaded by my mother to go back.’ 15.2.2-2 a bei4 passive construction can have the patient phrase only 15.58 那个鬼就被赶出来了。 na4ge4gui3jiu4bei4gan3chu1lai2le0thatCLghostthusBEIdrive_outLE ‘That ghost was chased out.’ 15.59 或者脚被踩了一下。 huo4zhe3jiao3bei4cai3le0yi1xia4orfootBEIstep_onLEoneCL ‘Or else (you) had your foot trodden on.’ 15.2.2-3 a different case—regardless of whether the agent phrase appears, the subject position is occupied by a zero anaphora, identified with an antecedent in the context 15.60 砍柴的人过了好几天还没回来，当地人就传说是被狮子吃掉了。 kan3chai2de0ren2guo4le0hao3ji3tian1hai2mei2hui2lai2dang1di4ren2jiu4chuan2shuo1shi4bei4shi1zi0chi1diao4le0chop_firewoodDEpersonpastLEquite_a_few_daysyetNEGcome_backlocalpeoplethusspreadbeBEIlioneatdropLE ‘When the firewood collectors had not come back after quite a few days, the locals spread the tale that (they) had been eaten by lions.’ 15.61 娼妓一但进入性工作，便被贴上了罪恶的标签。 chang1ji4yi1dan4jin4ru4xing4gong1zuo4bian4bei4tie1shang4le0zui4e4de0biao1qian1prostituteonceentersexjobthenBEIstickonLEsinDElabel ‘As soon as a prostitute starts as a sex worker, s/he’s given the label of a sinner.’ 15.2.3 Verbs in the passive construction 15.2.3-1 verbs in the passive construction—typical transitive activity verbs; cognition verbs, perception verbs, as well as experience verbs occur in bei passives 15.62 如果你不想一辈子被悔恨折磨，就不要听她的。 ru2guo3ni3bu4xiang3yi1bei4zi0bei4hui3hen4zhe2mo2jiu4bu4yao4tingta1de0ifyouNEGwantall_one’s_lifeBEIremorsetormentthusdo_notlistensheDE ‘If you do not want to be tormented by remorse for the rest of your life, don’t listen to her.’ 15.2.3-2 certain cognition or emotion verbs are allowed in the bei passive when are interpreted as an activity verb, and regularly depicts an adversative outcome for the subject NP 15.63 可惜，这一切都被巫婆知道了。 ke3xi1zhe4yi1qie4dou1bei4wu1po2zhi1dao4le0pitythiseverythingallBEIwitchknowLE ‘Unfortunately, all of this was found out by the witch.’ 15.2.3-3 stative kan4jian4 is interpreted as ‘catch sight of’ when it appears in a bei passive. Predicative adjectives can head the predicate of the passive when used as the resultative part of a compound 15.64 眼睛被激动的泪水弄模糊了。 yan3jing1bei4ji1dong4de0lei4shui3nong4mo2hu0le0eyeBEIstirredDEteardoblurredLE ‘(Her) eyes became blurred by tears of excitement.’ 15.2.3-4 intransitive verb is allowed to function as the head of the predicate in bei passives when it forms a resultative compound with another verb or adjective to indicate a change of status 15.65 …拼命寻找自己的独特风格，路好像被人走尽了。 pin1ming4xun2zhao3zi4ji3de0du2te4feng1ge2lu4hao3xiang4bei4ren2zou3jin4le0risk_lifeseekselfDEuniquestylewayseemBEIpeoplegoexhaustLE ‘(I) tried really hard to find my own distinct style, but it seemed that the pathways had all been fully explored by others.’ 15.2.4 Predicate types in passives 15.2.4.1 Predicate with perfective aspect marker 15.2.4.1-1 Predicate with perfective aspect marker 15.66 这个预算被立法院删了。 zhe4ge4yu4suan4bei4li4fa3yuan4shan1le0thisCLbudgetBEILegislative_YuancutLE ‘The budget was cut by the Legislative Yuan.’ 15.2.4.1-2 perfective guo4 in the bei passive—indicate that the subject has experienced the passive event at least once before the time of reference 15.67 我一生从未被别人如此侮辱过。 wo3yi1sheng1cong2wei4bei4bie2ren2ru2ci3wu1ru3guo4IlifeneverBEIotherssohumiliateGUO ‘I’ve never in my life been humiliated by other people like this.’ 15.68 毛寿先也被蛇咬过。 mao2shou4xian1ye3bei4she2yao3guo4MAO_SHOUXIANalsoBEIsnakebiteGUO ‘Mao Shouxian has also been bitten by a snake.’ 15.2.4.1-3 a bei clause without a perfective aspect marker can be acceptable if it is the first part of a compound sentence 15.69 那时就感到国家弱，被人欺，光是游行，烧东西不行。 na4shi2jiu4gan3dao4guo2jia1ruo4bei4ren2qi1guang1shi4you2xing2shao1dong1xi0bu4xing2at_that_timethusfeelcountryweakBEIhumanbullyjustdemonstrateburnthingsbe_no_good ‘At that time, I realized that our country was weak and was being bullied by others. Just joining rally on the street and burning things was not enough.’ 15.2.4.2 Imperfective aspect marker 着 zhe0 ‘ZHE’ 15.2.4.2-1 sometimes the bei predicate is marked with the imperfective zhe to describe the continuation of a situation that accompanies another situation or event 15.70 门被锁着进不去啊！ men2bei4suo3zhe0jin4bu4qu4a1doorBEIlockZHEcannot_get_inA ‘The door has been locked and we can’t get in!’ 15.71 大部分的寺庙都还被占用着，尚未归还。 da4bu4fen0de0si4miao4dou1hai2bei4zhan4yong4zhe0shang4wei4guai1huan2mostDEtempleallstillBEIoccupyZHEstillNEGreturn ‘Most of the temples were still being occupied by others and had not been returned.’ 15.2.4.3 Resultative and directional verb compounds 15.2.4.3-1 in most cases, the predicate of bei passives has a resultative or directional verb compound as the head, indicating the completeness of the situation 15.72 长城…被人以及大自然破坏了。 chang2cheng2bei4ren2yi3ji2da4zi4ran2po4huai4le0Great_WallBEIhumanandnaturedestroyLE ‘The Great Wall has been ruined by both people and nature.’ 15.73 大家都知道他是同志，被问烦了。 da4jia1dou1zhi1dao4ta1shi4tong2zhi4bei4wen4fan2le0everyoneallknowhebegayBEIquestion_until_annoyedLE ‘Everyone knew he was gay, so he was asked questions to the point of annoyance.’ 15.2.4.3-2 the directional verbs in the predicates of passive verbs entail a new location for the subject, as the result of a motion or event 15.74 他写的情书都被退回来了！ ta1xie3de0qing2shu1dou1bei4tui4hui2lai2le0hewriteDElove_letterallBEIsend_backLE ‘The love letters he wrote were all sent back!’ 15.75 四年前，我被医生诊断出患了胃癌。 si4nian2qian2wo3bei4yi1sheng1zhen3duan4chu1huan4le0wei4ai2fouryearagoIBEIdoctordiagnoseoutgetLEstomach_cancer ‘Four years ago, I was diagnosed with stomach cancer by the doctor.’ 15.2.4.3-3 resultative or directionaly compounds wth a potential form marked by the infix de/ bu (negative counterpart) typically do not appear in bei passives since such compounds do not signify a completed event. Note that lexicalized resultative compound kan-bu-qi/ kan-de-qi can co-occur with bei passives 15.76 我们的家庭被人看不起，所以孩子的心态上有些自卑。 家里的墙壁总是被她画得满满的。 jia1li3de0qiang2bi4zong3shi4bei4ta1hua4de0man2man3de0homeinDEwallalwaysBEIshepaintDEfullDE ‘The walls at home were always fully painted over by her.’ 15.78 少女被问得脸红了。
